text.p: NARODNA OBRODA - Slovak banks VUB, Postova Banka, Dopravna Banka and Prva Komunalna Banka will together provide a two billion crown loan for the state fund for building and maintaing roads. The loan should be used for covering part of the highway construction project.
- Parliament on Tuesday rejected an opposition vote of no-confidence concerning Education Minister Eva Slavkovska.
- Tatra Banka extended loans worth 159.25 million crowns as of September 30 within the framework of four foreign programmes to support small and medium-sized companies in Slovakia.
- The kidnappers of three Slovak workers in Ingushetia, near Chechnya, are still unknown, and the conditions for their release have not yet been announced.
- Some 150 firemen in Bratislava, out of the total 270, have begun a protest strike to demand better working conditions.
PRACA - The finance ministry is expected to approve on Wednesday an increase of maximum prices of motor fuels at the request of the oil refiner Slovnaft.

HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - Slovakia's engineering industry accounted for 18.7 percent of the country's overall industrial production in the first eight months of this year, compared with 16.7 percent in the same period of 1995. The engineering industry accounted for 24.7 percent of overall industrial exports in January-August period, some 4.6 percent more than in 1995.

- The state employment fund has lent around five billion crowns in the first nine months of this year to finance the official employment policy. More than half of the sum went into active employment policy.
PRAVDA - Parliamentary chairman Ivan Gasparovic said he did not expect parliament to change the current supervision of the state secret service SIS.
